name: Establishment Circulars
description: Official circulars on appointments, promotions, allowances, pensions, and reforms

questions.question: Which Establishment Circular formally approved paternity leave for officers in the Nigerian Public Service?
options: 2014 Circular on Leave Computation and Paternity Leave
questions.explanation: The 2014 OHCSF Circular on 'Computation of Leave Based on Working Days and Approval of Paternity Leave' formally introduced paternity leave for male officers.

questions.question: The Tenure Policy Circular of 2010 (reaffirmed in 2016) limits the tenure of Permanent Secretaries and Directors to how many years?
questions.explanation: The policy limits tenure to a maximum of eight years for both Permanent Secretaries and Directors to ensure succession and renewal.

questions.question: Which Establishment Circular clarified the procedure for acting appointments and payment of acting allowance?
questions.explanation: The 2013 OHCSF Circular clarified procedures for acting appointments, ensuring payment is only due when the officer acts for 14 days or more.

questions.question: According to the 2015 Establishment Circular, which platform was mandated for salary and personnel management across MDAs?
questions.explanation: The 2015 OHCSF Circular made the Integrated Personnel and Payroll Information System (IPPIS) mandatory for all MDAs to ensure payroll integrity.

questions.question: The 2012 Circular on Duty Tour Allowance revised rates based on what factor?
questions.explanation: The revised duty tour allowance rates were based on officers' grade levels to ensure equity and reflect inflation trends.

questions.question: The 2016 Circular on Performance Management introduced which key HR tool?
questions.explanation: The 2016 OHCSF Circular launched the Performance Management System (PMS) to replace the APER and align staff goals with organizational objectives.

questions.question: Which Establishment Circular emphasized the use of SERVICOM principles for improved service delivery?
questions.explanation: The 2011 Circular on Service Delivery reinforced SERVICOM principles to promote efficiency and citizen-focused service.

questions.question: Under the 2014 Circular, computation of leave days is based on which calendar basis?
questions.explanation: Leave computation was adjusted to working days, excluding weekends and public holidays, for fairness and clarity.

questions.question: The 2015 Circular on disciplinary procedures reaffirmed that disciplinary powers rest primarily with whom?
questions.explanation: Disciplinary powers for officers on the established cadre remain vested in the Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC).

questions.question: The 2013 Circular on redeployment stressed that redeployment within MDAs must be approved by whom?
questions.explanation: Redeployment within an MDA requires the approval of the Permanent Secretary to ensure transparency and documentation.

questions.question: The 2015 Establishment Circular directed that all leave rosters must be approved and submitted by which quarter of the year?
questions.explanation: All MDAs were directed to submit approved leave rosters by the first quarter to enable effective planning and control of absences.

questions.question: The Circular on IPPIS verification exercises in 2016 aimed primarily at achieving what?
questions.explanation: The IPPIS verification was introduced to eliminate ghost workers and ensure payroll integrity across MDAs.

questions.question: Which Establishment Circular clarified the need for biometric data integration of all public officers?
questions.explanation: The 2016 OHCSF Circular on biometric integration mandated all public officers to complete biometric registration to ensure identity verification.

questions.question: Under the 2013 Circular, when an officer is required to act in a higher post, how many days must he serve before earning acting allowance?
questions.explanation: An officer must act for a minimum of 14 days before qualifying for the payment of acting allowance.

questions.question: The 2017 Circular on Tenure Review emphasized what key principle?
options: Tenure to be based on political appointment
questions.explanation: The 2017 Circular reaffirmed strict adherence to the 8-year tenure limit for Permanent Secretaries and Directors.

questions.question: The 2011 Circular on staff welfare emphasized the establishment of which committee in MDAs?
questions.explanation: The 2011 Circular mandated the creation of Welfare Committees to oversee staff wellbeing and morale within MDAs.

questions.question: According to the 2016 Circular, who is responsible for cascading the Performance Management System (PMS) in MDAs?
options: The Head of the Civil Service
questions.explanation: Permanent Secretaries were tasked with cascading the PMS framework throughout their MDAs for full implementation.

questions.question: The 2013 Circular on Staff Loans directed that loan applications must be supported by what document?
questions.explanation: The Circular required that staff loan applications be accompanied by the applicant's most recent pay slip for verification.

questions.question: The 2015 Circular on disciplinary procedures aligned its reforms with which major document?
questions.explanation: The disciplinary procedures were aligned with the Public Service Rules to maintain uniformity in sanctions and due process.

questions.question: The 2014 Circular mandated that the annual performance review be signed by which two officials?
questions.explanation: The performance review must be jointly signed by the officer and his immediate supervisor to ensure accuracy and fairness.
